page.title: 13THE AMERICAN FOUNTAIN
page.content: The{fountain}was the gift of an American,George.W.Childs,to{Stratford} in the Jubilee year of{Queen} {Victoria.}It stands in Rother St.It is basically a square tower made from sandstone and granite with several turrets and many carvings.There are lions and eagles,the lions hold the {British emblem}and the eagles have the stars and stripes of the{American} {emblem.}On three sides of the fountain there are drinking troughs for animals Each side has a clock face,and the workings are inside the tower which has 16 leaded windows.On the south side there is a little wooden door and a carving of ears of corn and oak leaves. On the east side is the Tudor Rose and leeks.On the north side is the thistle and on the west is the shamrock.There is a weather vane on top and many gargoyles around it.
